alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:01PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Mercer, northeastern Henry, southern Washington, southwestern Muscatine, Louisa and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Washington, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ainsworth around 1110 PM CDT. Crawfordsville around 1115 PM CDT. Cotter and Wyman around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Columbus Junction, Columbus City, Letts, Wapello, Fruitland and Grandview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Iowa.
